data.title: Miles Dewey Davis Jr. (1898-1962)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Miles Davis Jr. born 1898 Noble Lake, Jefferson, Arkansas, United States died 1962 St. Louis, Missouri, United States including ancestors + descendants + 2 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 8 Nov 2021 | Created 28 Aug 2011

This page has been accessed 4,071 times.

Biography

He has 3 different birthdates:

Wikipedia--March 1, 1898[1]

Gravestone--1900[2]

Death certificate--May 14, 1903[3]

Miles Dewey Davis Jr. was an affluent American dentist and father of jazz musician and composer Miles Davis.

Davis was born on March 1, 1898 in Noble Lake, Arkansas. He was a son of Miles D. and Mary (Luster) Davis. He received his B. S. degree at Arkansas Baptist College in Little Rock in 1919. In 1924, Davis graduated from the dental school at Northwestern University in Chicago, Illinois and began his practice the same year. He was a member of the Omega Psi Phi fraternity and the National Medical Association.

On June 16, 1924, he married Cloots Mae (or Cleota) Henry. They had three children:

Dorothy Mae Davis (Mrs. Vincent Wilburn), born May 10, 1925— July 5, 1996

Miles Dewey Davis III, May 26, 1926 — September 28, 1991

Vernon Napoleon Davis, November 3, 1929 — December 15, 1999

Davis moved the family to Alton, Illinois, and then to East Saint Louis, Illinois, where he served as State Educational Director of the Elks Club. Very active socially and politically, he was also a member of the Masons, Knights of Pythias, American Woodsmen, and the N.A.A.C.P.

At one time, Davis made an unsuccessful bid for a seat on the Illinois State Legislature.

He died, at the age of about 62, on May 22, 1962 in St. Louis, Missouri. He is buried at the Washington Park Cemetery in Berkeley, St. Louis County, Missouri.[2]

Sources

↑ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miles_Dewey_Davis_Jr.

↑ 2.0 2.1 Find a Grave, database and images (https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27401764/miles-dewey-davis : accessed 08 November 2021), memorial page for Dr Miles Dewey Davis Jr. (14 May 1900–22 May 1962), Find a Grave Memorial ID 27401764, citing Washington Park Cemetery, Berkeley, St. Louis County, Missouri, USA ; Maintained by vfcooper (contributor 46935268) .

↑ https://s1.sos.mo.gov/Records/Archives/ArchivesMvc/ has death certificate as PDF
